title: High Expectations

en: A beta-tester sends you an ostensibly positive message.
They tell you they've been searching for something like this all their lives and can't wait to see the final product once "some of these annoying things are fixed."
Perhaps it should make you happy, but you instead feel dread. You don't even know this person - why are you worried about letting them down?

no_caption: Tell them you'll do your utmost

en: What you need right now is a break, not more pressure. You walk away, and shortly realize you have a choice in whether or not to apply these expectations to yourself.
You reply, assuring them you'll do your best to the best of your ability.
The exchange makes you realize why people have PR representatives.
